diff_hunk:
@@ -370,7 +370,9 @@ After Docker is installed, launch a Docker container with the TensorFlow binary
 image as follows.
 
 ```bash
-$ docker run -it -p 8888:8888 gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow
+$ docker run -d -p 8888:8888 --name="tensor" gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow
+
+$ docker exec -it tensor bash
body:
Any specific reason, why you would want to run the docker container in an interactive mode with the below command -

 `docker run -it -p 8888:8888 gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow`

Instead we could just run in a daemon mode, and use the Notebook App with the mapped port 8888. 

So I suggest we do -

`docker run -d -p 8888:8888 gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow`

Lastly, I agree this one is nicer. 

`$ docker run -it -p 8888:8888 --entrypoint /bin/bash gcr.io/tensorflow/tensorflow`

The above command will allow the developer to use the configured python in the container instance without installing anything on the Host machine. 

Thanks for consideration.
